_A_GLOBAL_PROPS_EXTRA_DESCRIPTION_: An object that contains variables for substitution in the translation template. It is used for dynamically replacing values in translation strings. For example, if the translation string has placeholders like "_WELCOME_{{foo}}_{{bar}}_", which is translated as "Welcome {{ foo }}: {{ bar }}", you can pass an object like { foo: "abc", bar: "123" }, and the result will be the translation "Welcome abc: 123".
_A_GLOBAL_PROPS_IS_TITLE_HTML_DESCRIPTIO: Determines whether the tooltip should be interpreted as HTML. If set to true, the content of the tooltip will be displayed with HTML formatting.
_A_GLOBAL_PROPS_TITLE_DESCRIPTION_: Sets the text of the tooltip that will appear when hovering over an element. The tooltip can be presented as plain text or an object for different devices (e.g., desktops and mobile devices).
_A_GLOBAL_PROPS_TITLE_PLACEMENT_DESCRIPT: Specifies the position of the tooltip relative to the element. Various positions are supported, such as top, bottom, left, right, and others. This property only works if isTitleHtml is set to true.
_A_TRANSLATION_PROPS_ALWAYS_TRANSLATE_DE: Determines whether translations for this component can be disabled. If set to true, translations cannot be turned off, and placeholders will not be shown instead.
